title: If x+|x|+y=7 and x+|y|-y=6 what is x+y=? - Quora

response.answer_text: Use definition of absolute value. |a|= a if a>=0 |a|=-a is a<0 Consider 4 cases. x>=0, y>=0. 2x+y=7, x=6. Then y=-5. This does not satisfy x>=0,y>=0.x>=0, y<=0. 2x+y=7, x-2y=6. x=4, y=-1. This is a good solution, x+y=3.x<0, y>0. No solution. Check it again.x<0, y<0. No solution. Check it again.

Only four choices: x>0 and y >0 that drives x = 6 and y = -5, Nokx>0 and y<0 that drives 2x + y = 7 and x - 2y = 6, meaning x = 4 and y = -1, Okx<0 and y>0 that drives y = 7 and x = 6,x<0 and y<0 that drives y = 7, Nok.Thus a single solution with x = 4 and y = -1
